catalog_metadata.title: Free Beat Maker Software & Music Education Tools Catalog

web_based_beat_makers.description: JavaScript frameworks for creating interactive music in the browser

tools.name: Tone.js

capabilities.synthesis: Built-in synths for complex sound generation
capabilities.sampling: Sample playback with Tone.Player and Tone.Sampler
capabilities.tempo: Beats per minute (BPM) control with musical notation (4n, 8t, 1m)

limitations: Steeper learning curve than visual tools

use_cases: Core framework for beat maker applications

tools.name: Howler.js

capabilities.format_support: MP3, MPEG, OPUS, OGG, WAV, AAC, M4A, MP4, WEBM, FLAC
capabilities.sprites: Sound sprite support for multiple clips in one file

limitations: Less comprehensive than Tone.js for music creation
tools.browser_compatibility: All modern browsers, good mobile support
tools.code_example: const sound = new Howl({ src: ['sound.mp3'] }); sound.play();

tools.name: Web Audio API

capabilities.analysis: AnalyserNode for frequency and waveform data

use_cases: Foundation for all web audio applications
combines_well_with: All web audio libraries build on this

tools.code_example: const audioCtx = new AudioContext(); const oscillator = audioCtx.createOscillator(); oscillator.connect(audioCtx.destination); oscillator.start();

visual_music_tools.description: Libraries for creating music visualizations and interactive audio-visual experiences

tools.name: p5.js Sound Library
limitations: Less comprehensive than Tone.js for music production
Primarily focused on visualization and interaction
Performance can be slower than optimized libraries
tools.code_example: let fft = new p5.FFT(); let spectrum = fft.analyze(); for (let i = 0; i < spectrum.length; i++) { line(i, height, i, height - spectrum[i]); }

tools.name: Three.js

capabilities.shaders: Custom GLSL shaders for advanced effects

limitations: Needs separate audio library for sound analysis
tools.code_example: const geometry = new THREE.SphereGeometry(1, 32, 32); // Modulate vertices based on audio frequency data

tools.name: Canvas API
limitations: Requires more code for complex visualizations
tools.code_example: const canvas = document.querySelector('canvas'); const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d'); ctx.fillRect(x, y, width, height);

midi_libraries.description: Libraries for MIDI input/output and musical instrument integration

tools.name: Web MIDI API

capabilities.device_access: Connect to MIDI keyboards, controllers, synthesizers

limitations: Not supported in all browsers (Firefox requires polyfill)
Needs external MIDI hardware or virtual ports

tools.name: WEBMIDI.js
limitations: Depends on Web MIDI API support

use_cases: MIDI keyboard input for web instruments

tools.name: JZZ (Jazz-Soft MIDI)

capabilities.polyfill: Enables Web MIDI in browsers without native support
capabilities.extended: More virtual MIDI ports than native API

limitations: May require plugins for full functionality
Slightly different API than native Web MIDI

music_theory_tools.description: JavaScript libraries for music theory concepts, scales, chords, and intervals

tools.name: Tonal.js

capabilities.typescript: Written in TypeScript with type definitions

tools.installation: npm install tonal or individual packages
tools.code_example: import { Scale, Chord } from 'tonal'; Scale.get('C major').notes; // ['C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G', 'A', 'B']

capabilities.notes: Note object with alterations, octaves, frequency
capabilities.chords: Jazz and classical chord support (Ab#5b9, F(#11))
capabilities.scales: Blues, flamenco, whole tone, double harmonic scales

audio_processing.description: Libraries for audio effects, waveform visualization, and signal processing

tools.name: Pizzicato.js

capabilities.sound_creation: From waveforms, files, microphone, or functions
capabilities.effects: Delay, reverb, distortion, flanger, tremolo, compression, filters

tools.code_example: var sound = new Pizzicato.Sound('sound.mp3'); sound.addEffect(new Pizzicato.Effects.Delay());

tools.name: Wavesurfer.js

capabilities.plugins: Regions, Timeline, Minimap, Envelope, Record, Spectrogram

limitations: Cannot add effects or manipulate audio

capabilities.low_latency: Runs in audio thread (zero additional latency)

ui_controls.description: Interactive user interface controls for music applications

tools.name: NexusUI

capabilities.controls: Dial, slider, button, toggle, keyboard, matrix, position

tools.code_example: var dial = new Nexus.Dial('#target'); dial.on('change', function(v) { synth.volume.value = v; });

free_desktop_software.description: Free desktop applications for music production and audio editing

tools.name: Audacity

capabilities.formats: Wide format support (WAV, MP3, OGG, FLAC)

use_cases: Export files for web beat makers

tools.workflow_integration: Create/edit samples → export → use in web beat maker

tools.name: LMMS (Linux MultiMedia Studio)

use_cases: MIDI file export for web apps

tools.workflow_integration: Compose in LMMS → export audio/MIDI → integrate with web tools

tools.name: Ardour
limitations: More complex than needed for beginners

for_educational_use.commercial_use: All listed tools allow commercial use, important for student portfolios

desktop_software.LMMS: GPL - Free, open source, modify and distribute

educational_platforms.EarSketch: Free for educational use, account required
educational_platforms.Chrome Music Lab: Free, built with open web technology

best_practices: Teach students about open source licenses
Use licenses as teaching moment for software ethics

getting_started_checklist: 2. Set up development environment (VS Code, browser, Node.js)
3. Start with simple project (Chrome Music Lab exploration)
4. Introduce coding gradually (p5.js → Tone.js → Web Audio API)
5. Combine desktop tools (Audacity/LMMS) with web tools
6. Build toward capstone project (custom beat maker)
teacher_preparation: Learn basics of JavaScript and Web Audio API
Set up classroom computers with required software
Plan integration with music theory curriculum
Prepare assessment rubrics for coding + music projects
student_progression: Semester 1: EarSketch + Chrome Music Lab + Audacity
Year 2: Advanced Tone.js + Web Audio API + custom projects
Capstone: Full beat maker application or original instrument
assessment_ideas: Create original composition using specific tools
Demonstrate music theory knowledge through code
Present portfolio of music + code projects
Collaborate on group music technology project
